page.title: 12A STREET BARBEQUE
page.content: Every year when it is near Midsummer, we have a barbeque on the field near where we live. People from far and near come to celebrate. we have the barbeque in rememberance of those who died in the Second World War. It stretches from the field right round to the street. There are cake and sweet stalls, and a man selling hot-dogs and pies. When we have had something to eat we play some games. We have an egg and spoon race, and a sack race. When it is near to the end we are entertained by clowns, dancers, and a magician. Any money raised is then given to the local old peoples home.
